alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 31 at 1:53PM CDT until September 01 at 4:46AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Pecos River Near Langtry affecting Val Verde County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pecos River Near Langtry. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, (4.0 meters), Turbulence in the river channel is dangerous to canoeists and kayakers. Flow inundates the lower banks of the canyon threatening sleeping campers and their gear. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 2.2 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 10/11/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Pecos River Langtry 10.0 13.6 Wed 1 pm CDT 3.4 3.0 2.5 &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
